ca2a8abe-44da-44b6-b0ce-9b07635755ba.name: Modifier
ca2a8abe-44da-44b6-b0ce-9b07635755ba.notes: Must enter "the Stalking" once every 20 days.

6af90638-9b98-4db7-90e0-38a1d5df7c3c.name: Directional
6af90638-9b98-4db7-90e0-38a1d5df7c3c.notes: @Direction: Back, Right, Left, Top or Underside@

26727c88-9333-4cb5-ae0a-0b8ad6dc600a.name: Tough Skin
26727c88-9333-4cb5-ae0a-0b8ad6dc600a.notes: Effects that just require skin contact or a scratch ignore this DR

5ce58efb-4d16-44b3-a627-611161b5f587.name: Partial (@Location, 1 level per -1 Per Hit Modifier, Torso is -10% thus level 1@)

6bf08ac9-f327-46db-9c85-00175d0b2583.name: Temperature Tolerance
6bf08ac9-f327-46db-9c85-00175d0b2583.notes:
"Comfort zone" is 35-124"F heat. The Drakarans evolved in desert lands: the function of their colorful scales is not so
much armor as to reflect heat and retain moisture. They prefer warm dry conditions that approximate the anceslral steppes of their homeworld.

ed8e76a9-8d46-4559-92cc-cae12e733d96.name: Quirk - Unfazeable
ed8e76a9-8d46-4559-92cc-cae12e733d96.notes: Drakarans rarely display emotion, and are not prone to panic (+1 to avoid Fright Checks)

bbad7b2a-8656-49b4-92ee-6f9bc3c449a6.name: Hard of Hearing
bbad7b2a-8656-49b4-92ee-6f9bc3c449a6.notes: -2 on any skill roll where it is important that you understand someone who is talking

b1b8b123-42b8-4619-96df-9993d0237c26.name: No Depth Perception
b1b8b123-42b8-4619-96df-9993d0237c26.notes: Instead of suffering the more severe penalties of One Eye. Their large eye gives a -2 when firing Snap Shots (or on Vision rolls to judge distances if the Drak docs not take a second to concentrate). There is no penalty when making Aimed attacks or in melee.

d49189cb-0488-4318-b629-6547d7b03c99.name: Truthfulness
d49189cb-0488-4318-b629-6547d7b03c99.notes: Make a self-control roll whenever you must keep silent about an uncomfortable truth (lying by omission). Roll at -5 if you actually have to tell a falsehood! If you fail, you blurt out the truth, or stumble so much that your lie is obvious.
